Data quality indicators are based on the coefficient of variation (CV), the non-response errors, the imputation errors, and subject matter expertise: A – Excellent; B - Very good; C - Good; D – Acceptable; E - Use with caution; F - Too unreliable to publish.
Data for the second and third quarters of 2020 are unavailable due to some Statistics Canada operations being temporarily suspended during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Industry estimates are based on the 2022 North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Version 1.0 (opens new window). The following categories are excluded from the survey: 'Religious organizations' (8131) within 'Religious
column9: 'Provincial and territorial public administration' (912) and 'International and other extra-territorial public administration' (919)."

column5: and professional and similar organizations" (813) as well as "Private households" (814)."

column4: "Provincial and territorial public administration" (912) and "International and other extra-territorial public administration" (919)."

column2: A job is vacant if it meets the following conditions: it is vacant on the reference date (first day of the month) or will become vacant during the month; there are tasks to be carried out during the month for the job in question; and the employer is actively seeking a worker outside the organization to fill the job. The jobs could be full-time, part-time, permanent, temporary, casual, or seasonal. Jobs reserved for subcontractors, external consultants, or other workers who are not considered employees, are excluded.
The employee" concept used in the Job Vacancy and Wage Survey (JVWS) is comprised of full-time employees
column7: and seasonal employees. It also includes working owners
column10: and other officers of incorporated businesses
column11: as well as employees who work off site (for example
column12: at home or on the road) but report to the location
column13: and those employees on paid leave. The "employee" concept used in the JVWS is meant to exclude owners or partners of unincorporated businesses and professional practices
column19: and military personnel. It also excludes employees on unpaid leave
column20: such as those on extended sick leave who are receiving insurance benefits."

column2: The job vacancy rate is the number of job vacancies expressed as a percentage of labour demand; that is, all occupied and vacant jobs.
